name: Extended Composite Name and Identification Number for Organizations
description: The XON data type is used to identify organizations with comprehensive naming and identification capabilities. It provides detailed organization identification including names, ID numbers, type codes, and assigning authorities. XON supports complex organizational hierarchies, multiple identifier types, and various naming conventions commonly used in healthcare for hospitals, laboratories, pharmacies, insurance companies, and other healthcare entities.

XON.1.name: Organization Name
XON.1.description: The name of the organization. This is the primary identifier by which the organization is commonly known.

XON.2.name: Organization Name Type Code
XON.2.description: Specifies the type of name being represented (e.g., legal name, display name, alias). Provides context for how the organization name should be interpreted.

XON.3.name: ID Number
XON.3.description: A numeric identifier assigned to the organization by an assigning authority. Used for unique identification within a specific context.

XON.4.name: Identifier Check Digit
XON.4.description: Check digit for the ID number to verify accuracy. Used for validation of the organization identifier.

XON.5.name: Check Digit Scheme
XON.5.description: The algorithm used to generate the check digit. Specifies the validation method for the organization identifier.

XON.6.name: Assigning Authority
XON.6.description: The organization or system that assigned the ID number. Hierarchic designator for the authority responsible for the identifier.

XON.7.name: Identifier Type Code
XON.7.description: Specifies the type of identifier being used (e.g., NPI, CLIA, DEA). Indicates the nature and purpose of the organization identifier.

XON.8.name: Assigning Facility
XON.8.description: The specific facility or location within the assigning authority where the identifier was assigned. Provides additional context for identifier assignment.

XON.9.name: Name Representation Code
XON.9.description: Specifies the character set and encoding used for the organization name. Supports international character sets and naming conventions.

constraints.identification: At least one of Organization Name or ID Number should be populated for meaningful identification
constraints.checkDigitLogic: If check digit is present, check digit scheme should also be specified
constraints.authorityContext: Assigning Authority provides essential context for identifier interpretation

nameTypes.L: Legal - official registered name of the organization
nameTypes.D: Display - name commonly used for display purposes
nameTypes.A: Alias - alternative name or doing business as (DBA) name
nameTypes.S: Stock Exchange - name used for trading purposes
nameTypes.C: Customary - name commonly used in practice

identifierTypes.NPI: National Provider Identifier - unique healthcare provider identification
identifierTypes.CLIA: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments - laboratory certification number
identifierTypes.DEA: Drug Enforcement Administration - controlled substance registration
identifierTypes.TIN: Tax Identification Number - federal tax identifier
identifierTypes.MEDICARE: Medicare Provider Number - CMS provider identification
identifierTypes.STATE: State License Number - state-issued organizational license

validationRules.minimumData: Either XON.1 (Organization Name) or XON.3 (ID Number) should be populated
validationRules.checkDigitConsistency: If XON.4 is present, XON.5 should specify the validation algorithm
validationRules.identifierValidation: ID numbers should follow format rules for the specified identifier type
validationRules.authorityValidation: Assigning Authority should be valid and recognized organization
validationRules.nameTypeValidation: Name Type Code should reference valid table values
